page.title: 02CLUBS IN PRESTON CAPES
page.content: Preston capes has a thriving Womens Institute. It was formed in 1924 with a break during the Second World War years. There are 28 members with 23 actively participating. It is a self-supporting charitable group. In l982 the upkeep of the Village Hall was taken over from the W.I. by a new Management Hall Committee made up of elected members of the Community. The Cricket Club was formed around l850 when all of the players lived in and around the village. Nowadays only 2 live in the area and 2 are ex-villagers. The Parochial Church Council deals with anything concerning the Church. Most residents support at least one of the organisations including the Conservative Association.
